results.title: Hidden treasures
results.creator_credit: David Gill, Kevin Brownlow and Thames Production
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “Unknown Chaplin”.
Featuring Charlie Chaplin in previously unseen home movies, scenes from abandoned films and scenes cut from release prints of the classics “City Lights” and “Modern Times”. Narrated by James Mason.

results.title: The Great director
results.creator_credit: David Gill, Kevin Brownlow and Thames Television
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Unknown Chaplin”.
The second of a trilogy throwing new light on Chaplin’s career in films. In 1917 he became independent and built his own studio. Stills, camera tests and rushes are organised to produce new insights into his famous classics, “The Kid”, “The Gold Rush” and “City Lights”. Narrated by James Mason. Rated: G

results.title: My happiest years
results.creator_credit: David Gill, Kevin Brownlow and Thames Television
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Unknown Chaplin”.
The first of a trilogy throwing new light on Chaplin’s career in films. This part covers the period in which he made twelve 2 reel comedies. Using footage selected from previously uncut rushes, the progression of Chaplin’s ideas is uncovered and insight is given into his working methods. Narrated by James Mason. Rated: G
results.creator_credit_for_label: David Gill, Kevin Brownlow and Thames Television

group_works.title: The Depths of space: exterior galaxies
The Milky way
group_works.creator_credit: Ruroy Sibley and I S O

results.title: The Milky way
results.creator_credit: Ruroy Sibley and I S O
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Universe”.
The stars and constellations of the Milky Way are shown by astronomical photography through the great telescope at Palomar Observatory, Mount Wilson, Harvard College, University of Colorado and the Yerkes Lowell and Lich Observatories. Various types of star clusters and nebular are included and the development of Nova Aquilae 1918 to 1932 is traced.

group_siblings.title: The Depths of space: exterior galaxies

results.title: The Depths of space: exterior galaxies
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Universe”.
The 200-inch telescope of Palomar Observatory reveals, to the limit of its two billion light year range, a universe strewn with other milky ways or galaxies like our own, with misty objects faintly visible which indicate that there are other galaxies lying beyond even that vast distance.

results.title: Will you join?
results.creator_credit: Keith Gow, Don Murray and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Union Representative”.
A new man starts work in a warehouse and is immediately approached by the union representative and told that it is in his best interests to join the Union. This approach offends the new man and he decides to seek another job. This film is an examination of the union delegate’s role and his manner in recruiting members.

group_siblings.title: Changes in the office

results.title: Changes in the office
results.creator_credit: Keith Gow, Don Murray and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Union Representative”.
The female union representative approaches a company manager to find out whether or not automated office equipment is to be installed which will cause fifty percent of the staff to be made redundant. Focuses on the manner in which the union delegate approaches the manager and how well she fulfils her role in representing the staff. Suitable for tertiary level.

results.title: A Personal matter
results.creator_credit: Keith Gow, Don Murray, Australian Council for Union Training and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Union Representative”.
A migrant worker in a factory needs time off to take his sick wife to hospital, but the union representative does not see this as a sufficiently important matter for him to deal with. Raises the question of prejudices and principles of justice and fair play in relation to the union’s responsibility to the individual worker.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Keith Gow, Don Murray, Australian Council for Union Training and Film Australia
